intro: Stigmaphyllon tarapotense, commonly known as the Andean starleaf, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
